column5: Cheese n crepes! That's terrifying. I don't ever plan on driving my vehicle on the ice...

This video has been going around social media for days now. It should be titled what not to do on ice. I don't get why they would drive right into that crack. Its clear that it was open, and refroze a bit....trucks don't just plunge through the ice..... The driver does something stupid and ends up in a crack usually.  S.

Oh boy...Let's just drive over a pressure crack without even getting out of the vehicle and inspecting.  Like Sinker said, that lake has about 3 ft of ice on it right now, you don't through for no reason.
Absolutely terrifying....  I'm always a bit jittery when I'm in a vehicle on the ice....I always have my seat belt off just in case I ever have to get out in a hurry....
Bail bail  Why are they driving on the ice?
I'm always a bit jittery when I'm in a vehicle on the ice....I always have my seat belt off just in case I ever have to get out in a hurry.... And the door open a crack with the radio off...
Anyone watch the myth busters episode about getting out of a submerged vehicle?  If not you should
That's just a snippet. They talk about the ways to actually get out and it's good info
Anyone watch the myth busters episode about getting out of a submerged vehicle?  If not you should I think there's a "bit" of difference when the waters 33F and your dressed with winter clothes.
Of course there is. Still doesn't change the basic "how the hell do I get out of a submerged vehicle" aspect  A jacket and snowpants doesn't change that lol
When she said, that's my life...take it, what was she referring too?
